page.title: 12 BETLEY SHOW
page.content: Betley show is held once a year on the first Saturday in August and is run by the horticultural society.There are lots of activities and competitions with animals like pigeons, rabbits and dogs.The competitions include painting.The prizes are 1st 50p, 2nd 30p, 3rd 20p.There are miniature gardens first prize is 60p, 2nd 30p,3rd 20p.The show is held at Speeds Farm and it is one of the main village events of the year.Miss Roydes opens it.A fair always comes to the show.All the profit is used to buy prizes and pay all expenses of running it.In the olden days you had to try to catch a pig and if you did you could have it.There are police there and ambulance people.There are traction engines done by Mick Matthews and E.C.Ambrose. Among the tents are the refreshments.
